result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gervall L Beles appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Gervall L Beles.  Attorney Jennifer L Pickett appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, AND 9:
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored. 

Court approves Zoom appearances at the next court date.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (28 pages) commencing 03-30-2022, by KATHERINE M. NELSON.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Gervall L Beles not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gervall L Beles in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Gervall L Beles in custody.  Jennifer Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective C. Schlachter. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court by video, defendant Gervall L Beles not in court, in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. The defendant is unavailable for court due to a medical appointment. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Gervall L Beles in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Gervall L Beles in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Gervall L Beles appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
